title: What are Polygons and non polygons? What are their differences? - Quora

response.answer_text: A polygon is any 2-dimensional shape formed with straight lines. The name tells you how many sides the shape has. For example, a triangle has three sides, and a quadrilateral has four sides. Shape 	# of SidesTriangle 	3Square 	4Rectangle 	4Quadrilateral 	4Pentagon 	5Hexagon 	6Heptagon 	7Octagon 	8Nonagon 	9Decagon 	10 Simple formula for polygon:N x Φ = 360° --> PolygonWhere,N – Numbers of sides in polygonΦ – Angel of single line from centre of polygon Above rule is satisfied is called polygon.

A Polygon is a closed geometric figure made up of three or more line segments all attached at their endpoints. Geometric shapes that are not polygons: A circle, because it is not made of line segments. Any shape that contains an arc length or segments that intersect somewhere other than their endpoints. A figure that is open like three sides of a square without the fourth side.
